Introduction to CSS

CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) controls the visual presentation of HTML elements. You use CSS to set colors, fonts, spacing, layout, and more.

Three Ways to Add CSS

  1. Inline — directly on an element via the style attribute.
  2. Internal — inside a <style> block in the head.
  3. External — in a separate .css file linked with <link> (recommended).
